content: What is the world's largest ocean by surface area?

The world's largest ocean by surface area is the Pacific Ocean. It covers approximately 63.1 million square miles (163.5 million square kilometers), which is about 46% of the Earth's total ocean area. The Pacific Ocean is bounded by the continents of Asia and Australia to the west, and the Americas to the east. It is also the deepest ocean, with the Mariana Trench reaching a depth of over 36,000 feet (10,972 meters).
